messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] deschooling for adults
messages.msgSnippet: ... Hi Tracy, There is a list with egroups deschoolingadults  maybe she could join that and ask some questions. Here is the subscription address
messages.messageBody:
On 19 Aug 2000, at 0:45, Tracy Oldfield wrote:

> Anyone got any good links for adult deschooling? I'm chatting with
> a friend who's feeling frustrated by her inability to learn (I know,
> don't get me started...) the thing is, she doesn't learn well from
> books and didn't like school when she was there, but is still stuck
> in the mentality, you know?
>
> Sooner the better!! TIA!
> Tracy

Hi Tracy,

There is a list with egroups deschoolingadults maybe she could
join that and ask some questions.

Here is the subscription address
DeschoolingAdults-subscribe@egroups.com



Sue

The Winona Farm in Minnesota Welcomes Unschoolers All Year Round
My website: http://members.xoom.com/sue_m_e
Farm website: http://members.xoom.com/winfarm/
Farm newsletter: http://www.onelist.com/subscribe/Winonafarm

"To believe in something, and not to live it,
is to be dishonest." -Mahatma Gandhi

messages.subject: deschooling for adults
messages.msgSnippet: Anyone got any good links for adult deschooling?  I m chatting with a friend who s feeling frustrated by her inability to learn (I know, don t get me
messages.messageBody:
Anyone got any good links for adult deschooling? I'm chatting with
a friend who's feeling frustrated by her inability to learn (I know,
don't get me started...) the thing is, she doesn't learn well from
books and didn't like school when she was there, but is still stuck
in the mentality, you know?

Sooner the better!! TIA!
Tracy
